control
Class PMSystem

java.lang.Object
  control.PMSystem
Direct Known Subclasses:
TestAcademicStaff, TestCoordinator, TestGeneralUser, TestSystemAdmin
public class PMSystem
extends java.lang.Object

The PMSystem class represents the publication management system, which is the entry of this program, and includes the most important components of this system: repository, the current frame and four controllers.

The PMSystem class is using singleton pattern, that makes it only possible to be one instance of PMSystem.

The PMSystem class is responsible for initialisation of repository, first frame, four controllers and the static final groupName list.

See Also:
Repository, GeneralUserController, AcademicStaffController, AdministratorController, CoordinatorController, HomePage, ViewPublication, AddPublication, EditPublication, LoginAsStaff, ViewPublicationAsStaff, AssignRole, ChangeStatus, DeletePublication, RegisterUser, SeminarGUI

Constructor Detail

PMSystem

protected PMSystem()
Initialises a newly created PMSystem object, and assign this instance to system.

Since PMSystem is using Singleton Pattern, the constructor of PMSystem is protected, which could only be called by public static method getSystemInstance().

Since using Singleton Pattern, the PMSystem class must not be public. And since in test cases, the constructor will be extended, the PMSystem must not be private. As a result, it can only be protected.

While initialising, repository will be assigned with a newly created Repository.

Since four controllers are using Lazy Initialisation Pattern, they will be assigned with null.

ArrayList groupName will be initialised with nine research groups names.

See Also:
repository, system, academicStaffController, administratorController, coordinatorController, generalUserController, currentFrame, groupName
Method Detail

getSystemInstance

public static PMSystem getSystemInstance()
Return the singleton instance of PMSystem.

A new instance of PMSystem will be created and assigned to PMSystem.system if it has not been initialised.

Returns:
The singleton instance of PMSystem

protected GeneralUserController getGeneralUserController()
Return the generalUserController to user interfaces for general user. New instance of GeneralUserController will be created and assigned to generalUserController, if and only if it has not been initialised.

run

public void run()
The run() method initialises the first frame as HomePage. The system start running when this method is called.

switchCurrentFrame

public void switchCurrentFrame(UserRole role,
                               int pagenumber)
Switch to another frame. The switchCurrentFrame() method could be called by any user interfaces.

Parameters:
role - UserRole type parameter representing which role the current user is.
pagenumber - Integer parameter representing which new frame is to be displayed.
See Also:
UserRole
